metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8866 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The AcquireMagickMemory function in MagickCore/memory.c in ImageMagick 7.0.3.3 before 7.0.3.8 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted image, which triggers a memory allocation failure.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-8862.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> incomplete fix of CVE-2016-8862 Upstream says it's an issue with address sanitizer throwing the error before malloc() and mmap() return failure. Marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: imagemagick: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
